column1: CEO for Computational Biology / TechBio Startup;"SynBioCAD is a toolshed for synthetic biology
column3: and industrial biotechnology. The tools and workflows currently shared on the portal enable one to build libraries of strains that produce desired chemical targets covering an end-to-end metabolic pathway design and engineering process. The toolkit lets one do everything from the selection of strains and targets
column4: the design of DNA parts to be assembled
column5: to the generation of scripts driving liquid handlers for plasmid assembly and strain transformations. The software provides a graphical user interface that allows users to drag-and-drop components into a design canvas
column6: and then uses a set of algorithms to automatically generate a corresponding DNA sequence. These features make this tool a valuable addition to a biological engineer’s bench desk
column7: accelerating the development of synthetic biology and metabolic engineering technologies

column3: Diagnostics (m/f/d);"The Helmholtz Institute for RNA-based Infection Research (HIRI) is offering a Postdoctoral position: ""Developing and commercializing CRISPR-based diagnostics"" (m/w/d) in the Research Group of RNA Synthetic Biology (RSYN) under the direction of Prof. Chase Beisel. The Helmholtz Institute for RNA-based Infection Research (HIRI) was established in May 2017 as a joint venture between the Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research (HZI) in Braunschweig and the Julius Maximilian University of Würzburg (JMU). The HIRI is the first research institution worldwide to exclusively address the role of RNA in infection processes. Based on novel findings
column4: innovative therapeutic approaches are developed in an integrated research approach and made clinically usable through the development of pharmaceutical forms of application. For more information
column5: please visit . The RSYN research group focuses on characterizing and harnessing CRISPR-Cas systems toward better understanding
column7: and treating human infections. The postdoctoral fellow will help lead efforts further developing a new CRISPR technology called LEOPARD for multiplexed RNA detection (Jiao et al.
column8: Science 2021). The project involves extending the existing platform to setups that can be implemented in different diagnostic settings. The project will then transition into a spin-off
column9: with the postdoc envisioned as a key member of the start-up team. PhD or equivalent in biology

The place of work is Würzburg. The position is suitable for part-time work. The HZI strives for professional equality between women and men. Therefore
column23: women are especially encouraged to apply. People with severe disabilities and equivalent professional qualifications who are suitable for the position are given preference. In order to protect your rights

column1: Master Thesis | Process development for the biocatalytic synthesis of...;"The Max Planck Institute for Dynamics of Complex Technical Systems in Magdeburg offers a position for a master thesis (m/f/d) with the topic ""Process development for the biocatalytic synthesis of oligosaccharides"". The start is planned for end 2022/early 2023. Activities and responsibilities Biocatalytic processes for the synthesis of valuable oligosaccharides are gaining importance in the field of applied synthetic biology. The team for synthetic biotechnology has developed multiple enzymatic pathways for the synthesis of activated building blocks. In a master project
column2: the synthesis will be scaled gradually to litre scales using cutting-edge technologies. Moreover
column3: downstream processes for the purification of the synthesized products will be established. The project is set up very interdisciplinary
column4: including challenges in the fields of biocatalysis and downstream processing as well as reaction analytics and recombinant enzyme expression. We are seeking a highly-motivated candidate with excellent basic knowledge of biotechnology and an interest in developing biocatalytic processes. The working packages in detail are: High cell density cultivation for the production of biocatalysts in litre scale Enzyme production by using stateof-the-art vector systems Upscaling of the biocatalytic synthesis of one selected oligosaccharide Downstream processing of the reaction product by filtration and chromatographic methods Analytics employing ion chromatography HPAECUV/PAD The candidates will have the opportunity to work on key technologies and use state-of-the-art equipment in an international group of young and aspiring researchers. In-depth supervision and training will be provided by MPI staff. Qualification profile Background in Biotechnology

column1: International PhD Program in Microbiology | Fully Funded PhD Positions;"International PhD Program in MicrobiologyFully Funded PhD Positions We are excited to invite applicants with a strong interest for interdisciplinary research in modern microbiology to apply for fully funded PhD positions at the International Max Planck Research School Principles of Microbial Life.
Applicants should hold an MSc degree or equivalent in biology
column11: or another relevant field. The International Max Planck Research School Principles of Microbial Life is a joint initiative of the University of Marburg
column12: the Max Planck Institute for Terrestrial Microbiology
column13: and the Center for Synthetic Microbiology. More than 35 research groups participate in the program and cover research in Cellular organization and architecturePhysiology and metabolismMicrobial communities and interactionsHost-microbe interactions Signal transduction and information processingSystems and synthetic biology We offer: A research project in a vibrant
column14: international research community Mentoring by world-class scientists through a thesis advisory committee Access to state-of-the-art research facilities Structured interdisciplinary training program which includes lectures
column17: attendance to retreats and conferences Salary based on the Collective Agreement for the Public Service in Germany (TVöD) which includes health and social insurance coverage Assistance service for international researchers Deadline for applying is January 31
column18: 2023. Apply directly via the online application system. Accepted candidates can start their PhD projects already in summer of 2023. The PhD program starts in October 2023. For more information about the International Max Planck Research School Principles of Microbial Life
